Matthew Waliman CV Publications Projects mwaliman@ucla.edu

Hi, I’m Matthew!

I’m an Electrical and Computer Engineering M.S. student at UCLA.

My research interests are Human Computer Interaction, Graphics and Computer Vision. I did my undergrad at UC Berkeley where I worked with Prof. Avideh Zakhor and Prof. Bjoern Hartmann.

Publications

Making Every Step Count: Minute-by-Minute Characterization of Step Counts Augments Remote Activity Monitoring in People With Multiple Sclerosis Matthew Waliman, Valerie J. Block, Zhendong Xie, Amit Akula, Riley Bove, Mark J. Pletcher, Gregory M. Marcus, Jeffrey E. Olgin, Bruce A. C. Cree, Jeffrey M. Gelfand, Roland G. Henry. frontiers in Neurology, 2022. Deep Learning Method for Height Estimation of Sorghum in the Field using LiDAR Matthew Waliman, Avideh Zakhor. SPIE, 2020. Height Estimation of Biomass Sorghum in the Field Using LiDAR Matthew Waliman, Avideh Zakhor. SPIE, 2019.

Latest News

  • I started an Electrical Computer Engineering M.S. at UCLA Sep 2021
  • I joined the Roland Henry Lab at UCSF Jun 2019
  • I graduated from UC Berkeley May 2018
